newsitem.title: UK: Prince Charles launches attack on ugly mass tourism.
newsitem.headline: Prince Charles launches attack on ugly mass tourism.

text.p: Prince Charles on Friday attacked "eyesore" hotels and said insensitive mass tourism should not be allowed to destroy the beauty spots of the world.
The prince, a keen environmentalist and forthright critic of modern architecture, launched his ecology crusade with an article in the Green Hotelier Magazine.

"Customers, employees, governments and local communities will surely reward hoteliers who safeguard rather then endanger the environment and who preserve rather than despoil our natural treasures for the benefit of future generations," he wrote.
In his first major project since his divorce last month from Princess Diana, he praised the "handful of sensitive developers, planners, architects and builders" who take the environment into account.
Calling for more sympathetic development, the British heir to the throne said there were "too many eyesores" designed as cheap, featureless dormitory blocks.
